title-part.text: COMPOUNDS OF THE METALS BERYLLIUM, MAGNESIUM, ALUMINIUM, CALCIUM, STRONTIUM, BARIUM, RADIUM, THORIUM, OR OF THE RARE-EARTH METALS

CPC-specific-text.text: monoborane, diborane or addition complexes thereof

reference.text: C01B6/00; salts of oxyacids of halogens C01B11/00; peroxides, salts of peroxyacids C01B15/00; sulfides or polysulfides of magnesium, calcium, strontium, or barium C01B17/42; thiosulfates, dithionites, polythionates C01B17/64; compounds containing selenium or tellurium C01B19/00; binary compounds of nitrogen with metals C01B21/06; azides C01B21/08;

CPC-specific-text.text: compounds other than ammonia or cyanogen containing nitrogen and non-metals and optionally metals C01B21/082; amides or imides of silicon C01B21/087

reference.text: ; phosphides C01B25/08; salts of oxyacids of phosphorus C01B25/16; carbides C01B31/30; compounds containing silicon C01B33/00; compounds containing boron C01B35/00; compounds having molecular sieve properties but not having base-exchange properties C01B37/00; compounds having molecular sieve and base-exchange properties, e.g. crystalline zeolites, C01B39/00;cyanides C01C3/08; salts of cyanic acid C01C3/14; salts of cyanamide C01C3/16; thiocyanates C01C3/20;

CPC-specific-text.text: double sulfates of magnesium with sodium or potassium C01D5/12; with other alkali metals C01D15/00, C01D17/00

title-part.text: Methods of preparing compounds of the metals beryllium, magnesium, aluminium, calcium, strontium, barium, radium, thorium, or the rare earths, in general

CPC-specific-text.text: Fluorides or double fluorides of beryllium with alkali metals or ammonium; Preparation of beryllium compounds therefrom

title-part.text: by thermal decomposition of magnesium compounds
by thermal decomposition of magnesium chloride with water vapour
by thermal decomposition of magnesium sulfate, with or without reduction
by treating magnesia, e.g. calcined dolomite, with water or solutions of salts not containing magnesium
by precipitation from solutions of magnesium salts with ammonia
from magnesium compounds with alkali hydroxides or alkaline- earth oxides or hydroxides

CPC-specific-text.text: Dehydrating ammonium or alkali magnesium chlorides, e.g. carnalite

title-part.text: Preparation of anhydrous magnesium chloride by chlorinating magnesium compounds
Dehydrating magnesium chloride containing water of crystallisation

reference.text: double sulfates of magnesium with sodium or potassium C01D5/12, with other alkali metals

CPC-specific-text.text: Compounds containing, besides aluminium, two or more other elements, with the exception of oxygen and hydrogen

reference.text: compounds containing aluminium, fluorine and alkali or alkaline earth metals C01F7/54; compounds containing sulfur and other cations besides aluminium C01F7/68

CPC-specific-text.text: containing, besides aluminium, only anions, e.g. Al(OH)xCLy(SO4)z
e.g. leaching of bauxite according to the Bayer process

reference.text: obtaining aluminium oxide or hydroxide from the resulting aluminate solution C01F7/14

CPC-specific-text.text: Make-up of the alkali hydroxide solution from recycled spent liquor
Pretreatment of the minerals, e.g. grinding
Processes making use of tube digestion only
characterised by the use of additives
Apparatus for digestion, e.g. digestor vessels, heat exchangers
Separation of the insoluble residue, e.g. red mud
characterised by the flocculant added to the slurry

reference.text: final clarification of the aluminate solution C01F7/47

CPC-specific-text.text: from waste-like raw materials, e.g. fly ash, Bayer calcination dust

title-part.text: by treating aluminous minerals with sodium carbonate,
by treating aluminous minerals with alkali sulfates and reducing agents
Alkali metal aluminates from alkaline-earth metal aluminates
Aluminium oxide or hydroxide from alkali metal aluminates

CPC-specific-text.text: from aqueous aluminate solutions by neutralisation with an acidic agent
from aqueous aluminate solutions by precipitation due to cooling, e.g. as part of the Bayer process
characterised by a crystal growth modifying agent other than aluminium hydroxide seed
Separation of the obtained hydroxide, e.g. filtration, dewatering

title-part.text: Aluminium oxide or hydroxide from alkaline-earth metal aluminates
Preparation of aluminium oxide or hydroxide from aluminous ores with acids or salts
with nitric acid or nitrogen oxides
Preparation of aluminium oxide or hydroxide by thermal decomposition

CPC-specific-text.text: Hydrolysis or oxidation of gaseous aluminium compounds in the gas phase
Thermal decomposition of hydrated chlorides, e.g. aluminium trichloride hexahydrate

title-part.text: Preparation of aluminium hydroxide by precipitation from solutions containing aluminium salts
Preparation of aluminium oxide by thermal reduction of aluminous minerals
in the presence of aluminium sulfide
Preparation of aluminium oxide or hydroxide from metallic aluminium, e.g. by oxidation

CPC-specific-text.text: by oxidation with a gaseous oxidator at a high temperature
by applying mechanical energy to solid aluminium at a low temperature
by oxidation in an aqueous solution
i.e. all conversions of one form into another involving a loss of water
in presence of a calcination additive
making use of a fluidised bed
using superatmospheric pressure, e.g. hydrothermal conversion of gibbsite into boehmite

title-part.text: Purification of aluminium oxide, aluminium hydroxide or aluminates

CPC-specific-text.text: e.g. removal of compounds of Si, Fe, Ga or of organic compounds from Bayer process liquors
Removal of organic compounds, e.g. sodium oxalate

title-part.text: Double compounds containing both fluorine and other acid
Double compounds containing both aluminium and alkali metals or alkaline-earth metals

CPC-specific-text.text: Preparation from elemental aluminium or elemental aluminium containing materials, e.g. foil, dross
Preparation from silicoaluminious materials, e.g. clays, bauxite
i.e. compounds containing, besides aluminium and sulfate ions, only other cations
Ammonium or alkali metal aluminium sulfates

title-part.text: Compounds of calcium, strontium, or barium

CPC-specific-text.text: Preparation involving liquid-liquid extraction, absorption or ion-exchange
Preparation of calcium carbonate by carbonation of aqueous solutions and characterised by control of the carbonation conditions
Preparation of calcium carbonate by carbonation of aqueous solutions and characterised by an additive other than CaCO3-seeds
the additive being an organic compound
Preparation of calcium carbonate by carbonation of solutions based on non-aqueous solvents
After-treatment, e.g. grinding, purification, conversion of crystal morphology

title-part.text: by chlorination of alkaline-earth metal compounds
Preventing the adsorption of moisture or caking
Preparation with nitric acid or nitrogen oxides
Preparation by double decomposition with nitrates
Preventing the absorption of moisture or caking

CPC-specific-text.text: for the production of calcium sulfate cements
Sulfates of Ca from gases containing sulfur oxides
Conversion of one form of calcium sulfate to another

title-part.text: Compounds of the rare earth metals, i.e. scandium, yttrium, lanthanum, or the group of the lanthanides

note.note-paragraph: In this group "rare earth metals" means one single element or a combination of elements taken from the group as specified above

CPC-specific-text.text: Preparation involving a liquid-liquid extraction, an adsorption or an ion exchange
Compounds containing besides rare earth metals two or more other element with the exception of oxygen or hydrogen, e.g. La4S3Br6 or ternary oxides or hydroxides, e.g. NaCeO2

reference.text: compounds containing besides rare earth metals only different halogens, e.g. Sc C01F17/0056
ternary oxides or hydroxides, e.g. NaCeO2 C01F17/0018
